identificationModule.briefTitle: Detection of Urinary Human Chorionic Gonadotropin (hCG)
identificationModule.officialTitle: Detection of Urinary HCG During The Not Pregnancy and Pregnancy Cycles

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The Mira Pregnancy Test is an over-the-counter urine hCG test intended for early detection of pregnancy. The test is indicated for use four days before the expected period. Throughout this study, volunteers with non-medical backgrounds were recruited to test hCG with urine samples using the Mira Pregnancy Test during the not pregnancy cycle or pregnancy cycle. To perform the study, a total number of more than 200 volunteers will be recruited to participate in the study.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
The studies include two parts, which are a lay user study and a urine samples test during the trying to conceive cycle.

Part 1: Lay user study Part 2: Detection of hCG in Early Pregnancy Clinical Samples

armGroups.label: Women who are trying to conceive
interventionNames: Device: Daily test with urine by the product

interventions.name: Daily test with urine by the product
interventions.description: Women perform the hCG test and share the test results
armGroupLabels: Women who are trying to conceive

primaryOutcomes.measure: Cognitive evaluation via survey and calculating the consistency
primaryOutcomes.description: The consistency between the lay-user test results and the actual test results

primaryOutcomes.measure: The accuracy of data was expressed as per the Pregnancy Detection Rate
primaryOutcomes.description: The number of positive results on different days obtained by the user of the Mira pregnancy test is divided by the total number of women who confirmed pregnancy.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Female
* Aged 18 and over
* Willing to give informed consent
* Willing to conduct a personal home pregnancy test and reveal their pregnancy status
* Have a working smartphone

Exclusion Criteria:

* Have a medical background or have been in a related industry/occupation
* Volunteers who are unfit to participate in the research by the researcher
* Used the investigational pregnancy test previously
* Has a medical condition
* Confirmed to be pregnant by a healthcare professional and beyond the first trimester (defined as last menstrual period (LMP) +13 weeks)
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Include more than 200 worldwide women aged 18 and over taking part in this study.
